frame.name: Employer_scenario
frame.definition: <def-root>The sequence of events in which the <fen>Employer</fen> hires an <fen>Employee</fen>, employs them in a <fen>Position</fen> for some <fen>Duration</fen>, and finally lets them go from the <fen>Position</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Compensation
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Compensation</fen> is the payment that the <fen>Employee</fen> receives for performing a <fen>Task</fen>.
<ex>I think you should <t>hire</t> him <fex name="Compense">at $15 an hour</fex>, not a penny more.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Employee
FE.definition:
<def-root>The person who is obligated to perform some <fen>Task</fen> in order to receive <fen>Compensation</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Empee">I</fex> was just <t>hired</t> yesterday!</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Employer
FE.definition: <def-root>The person (or institution) that gives <fen>Compensation</fen> to an <fen>Employee</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Position
FE.definition: <def-root>The label given to a particular type of employment. <ex>Look, I wasn't <t>hired</t> <fex name="Position">as your waitress</fex>!</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Task
FE.definition:
<def-root>Task identifies the action that the <fen>Employee</fen> is obligated to do for the <fen>Employer</fen>.
<ex>I was <t>hired</t> <fex name="Task">just to empty the trash cans</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Field
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Field</fen> in which one works. <ex>We <t>hired</t> only five <fex name="Field">in finance</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Duration
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the amount of time for which the <fen>Employee</fen> continues in employ.</def-root>
